This unknown species has been identified as
Lasioglossum ( Hemihalictus ) sexstrigatus (Schenck, 1869)
in Japan . According to DNA analysis in the present study, the pair-wise sequence divergence between Japanese and European specimens was quite clear (7.3–7.9% between
L. sexstrigatus
and L . sp. in Table 1 ). Morphologically, females of this species are slightly different from
L . ( H .) sexstrigatus
as the mesoscutum has a weak tessellation over the entire surface (in contrast, in
L. ( H. ) sexstrigatus
, the mesoscutum is nearly smooth on the posterior half).
In the present study, I could not conclude that this unknown species is either undescribed or a known species, but this will be examined in further studies.
